profile_positions.description:
Ph.D. Research in Chemical Engineering - Process Intensification/biofuels
Topic: Evaluation of a membrane contactor reactor (MCR) for biodiesel production.
Activities:
- Bibliographic review and definition of state of the art. Identification of innovation opportunities.
- Experimental design and execution.
- Presentation of reports, scientific papers, and results presentations.
- Development of a gas chromatography analysis methodology.

Awards:
Doctoral Scholarship "FAPERJ Nota 10" March 2019 edition.

Experimentation concluded
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Main activities Production Process:
- Basic and detailed engineering for the production plant of biodiesel from used cooking oil, using a hydrodynamic cavitation reactor.
- Equipment sizing, calculation memories, process diagrams (PFD and P&ID), mass and energy balances, equipment list, and technical specifications. Construction and assembly commissioning.
- Supervision for design, construction, and assembly of highly complex equipment: heat exchangers and distillation column.
- Inspection of civil, mechanical, and electrical works.
- Follow-up of the start-up procedure and identification of operational failures.
- Monitoring of the production process: mass and energy balances, production indicators.
- Identification of bottlenecks and creation of operational strategies.
- Establishment of operational and operational safety procedures.
- Selection and permanent training of factory staff.

Main activities Quality Control Laboratory:
- Establishment of quality procedures in accordance with current regulations.
- Test development for quality control of the raw material: used vegetable oil.
- Acquisition of laboratory equipment.
- Development of the procedure for biodiesel analysis by gas chromatography according to ASTM D6584.
- Development of the moisture analysis procedure by Karl-Fischer according to ASTM E203.
- Development of total acid number (TAN) analysis procedure according to ASTM D664.
- Supervision during the quality laboratory adaptation process.
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer

profile_positions.description: Graduate research student (Master's level) in the research project "Continuous production of methyl esters in a falling film reactor coupled to a hollow fiber membrane module". Project developed by the Department of Chemical Engineering of the National University of Colombia (Bogotá) and by the Alberto Luiz Coimbra Institute of Graduate Studies and Research in Engineering at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

profile_positions.description: Technical and scientific support in the biodiesel manufacture and characterization for the project "Technological investigation of the use of Jatropha Curcas oil as an alternative fuel for compression ignition engines at Carbones del Cerrejón Ltda."

school.name: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro

company.name: CEPEL
company.description: O Centro de Pesquisas de Energia Elétrica (CEPEL) foi criado em 1974 e sua sede é localizada no Rio de Janeiro (Ilha do Fundão). Faz parte do sistema Eletrobrás e tem 35 anos em pesquisa e desenvolvimento (P&D) relacionado a geração, transmissão e distribuição de energia elétrica e sendo considerado o maior centro de pesquisas em energia elétrica do Hemisfério Sul.
